“ Sadā”,

analyzed: mchu dang po las kyang byung ba'i wa yig la mchu las byung ba'i aoo a'a ga ma'o //

translated: Now, in the augmentations of the āgama, the vowels are changed in the explanation of the yavakāra. Why are the y and v not changed to e and o?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

translated: This is a general statement about the completion of all the feet.

original: aadza sogs dang aata mtha' las aa pa'o //
analyzed: aadza sogs dang aata mtha' las aa pa'o //
translated: From ajas and so on, and from at the end, it becomes a.

original: gang gi tshogs kyi dang po aa dza'i sgra yin pa de aa dza sogs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshogs kyi dang po aa dza'i sgra yin pa de aa dza sogs so //
translated: That which begins with the group a-ja- is a-ja- and so on.

original: rtags gang gi mtha' aa ta yin pa de aata mtha'o //
analyzed: rtags gang gi mtha' aa ta yin pa de aata mtha'o //
translated: That which ends with the sign a-ta is a-ta-end.

original: de nas zaso dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zaso dbye ba'o //
translated: Then, the division of the vowels.

original: dzas sogs kyi tshogs dang aata mtha' ste /🔽aa yig mtha' @148a * //
analyzed: dzas sogs kyi tshogs dang aata mtha' ste / aa yig mtha' @148a * //

analyzed: pa yig ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to // aa dz'a / ae da k'a /

analyzed: tsa da ka:/ aa shv'a /

analyzed: tri pha l'a /

analyzed: damshta / dru dha /

original: aushni hra / aushni h'a /
analyzed: aushni hra / aushni h'a /

analyzed: de ba bi s'a /
translated: deva-viśa🔽vāla

analyzed: b'a l'a / wat+s'a /

analyzed: dzyoshtha / ka nishtha /

analyzed: ma dhyam\/ ko ki l'a /

original: aata mtha' las ;
analyzed: aata mtha' las ;
translated: a-ta-end

original: de ba datta /
analyzed: de ba datta /
translated: deva-datta

original: 'o na aa dza sogs rnams aa yig mtha' can yin pas da rnams de las thams cad du blangs pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na aa dza sogs rnams aa yig mtha' can yin pas da rnams de las thams cad du blangs pa don med do zhe na /
translated: Now, since a-ja- and so on end with the letter a, it is pointless to take all of them from that.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: gang aa dzi sogs kyi tshogs de rnams aa yig mtha' can dkyus mar bklag par mi bya bas de rnams aata mtha' smos par ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang aa dzi sogs kyi tshogs de rnams aa yig mtha' can dkyus mar bklag par mi bya bas de rnams aata mtha' smos par ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: The collection of letters such as aji are not read in the ordinary way as ending in the letter a. So how could they be established as ending in atam?

original: gang de rnams ni aa yig mtha' can las thams cad du nye bar blangs pa ni gnod pa can dang gnod pa byed pa'i don no //
analyzed: gang de rnams ni aa yig mtha' can las thams cad du nye bar blangs pa ni gnod pa can dang gnod pa byed pa'i don no //
translated: The letters aji and so on are always taken to be a and the meaning of atam is that which is harmed and that which harms.

original: de la a'a dza dang ae da k'a zhes sogs rnams ni rigs brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de la a'a dza dang ae da k'a zhes sogs rnams ni rigs brjod pa ste /
translated: In this regard, aji and eḍaka and so on are the expression of a class.

original: rigs las y'a au pa dh'a min pa las zhes pas ai yig gi rkyen thob pa de 'gegs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs las y'a au pa dh'a min pa las zhes pas ai yig gi rkyen thob pa de 'gegs pa ste /
translated: Since the class is not from yaupaḍha, the condition of the vowel i is obtained and that is blocked.

original: tri pha l'a'i sgra la ba gnyis pa zhes pas a'i thob pa dang / damsht'a'i sgra la sha dang da rjes su 'brel pa la zhes pa 'dis dang / ba la dang wansa dag la na tshod dang po las zhes pa 'dis dang / dzyoshtha dang ga nishtha dang ma dhya ma rnams las skyes pa sbyor ba'i mthas gal te brjod na zhes pa 'dis thob pa'o //
analyzed: tri pha l'a'i sgra la ba gnyis pa zhes pas a'i thob pa dang / damsht'a'i sgra la sha dang da rjes su 'brel pa la zhes pa 'dis dang / ba la dang wansa dag la na tshod dang po las zhes pa 'dis dang / dzyoshtha dang ga nishtha dang ma dhya ma rnams las skyes pa sbyor ba'i mthas gal te brjod na zhes pa 'dis thob pa'o //
translated: The word triphāla has the meaning “two a’s” by the rule “a twice” (dviguṇa). The word daṃṣṭra has the meaning “daṃ and śa” by the rule “daṃ and śa” (daṃśa). The words bala and vāna have the meaning “from the first age” by the rule “from the first age” (prathama). The words jyoṣṭha, gāniṣṭha, and madhyama have the meaning “if expressed by the final of the compound” by the rule “if expressed by the final of the compound” (yadi samāmnātā).

original: ma ha ta snga ma can min pa'i su tra'i sgra las rigs brjod pa la a'as brjod de /
analyzed: ma ha ta snga ma can min pa'i su tra'i sgra las rigs brjod pa la a'as brjod de /
translated: The word mahāsutrā, which does not have a preceding mahā, has the meaning “family” by the rule “a is expressed by a”.

original: su tr'a rigs las ya au pa dh'a min pa la zhes pas ai yig thob pa la'o //
analyzed: su tr'a rigs las ya au pa dh'a min pa la zhes pas ai yig thob pa la'o //
translated: The word sutrā has the meaning “not from the family of yaupaḍha” by the rule “from the family” (gotra).

original: rigs brjod pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: rigs brjod pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the expression of the family?

original: shu tra sa bh'ar++ya /
analyzed: shu tra sa bh'ar++ya /
translated: Śūdra sabhārya.

original: shu tri skyes pa sbyor ba'i mtha'i zhes pas a'i yig go //
analyzed: shu tri skyes pa sbyor ba'i mtha'i zhes pas a'i yig go //
translated: Śūdri has the meaning “born” by the rule “final of the compound” (samāmnātā).

original: ma hata snga ma can min pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ma hata snga ma can min pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of not having a preceding mahā?

original: ma h'a shu tri /
analyzed: ma h'a shu tri /
translated: Mahāśūdri.

original: ma h'a shu tra'i sgra 'di a'a bhi ra'i rigs brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ma h'a shu tra'i sgra 'di a'a bhi ra'i rigs brjod pa'o //
translated: The word mahāśūdrī is the expression of the family of ābhira.

original: rita dang na mtha' rnams las ni a'i'o //🔽rita dang na ni rita na ste /
analyzed: rita dang na mtha' rnams las ni a'i'o // rita dang na ni rita na ste /
translated: The final letters of the groups rit and na are changed to ai.🔽The final letters of the groups rit and na are changed to ai.

original: ri yig gi mtha' can rnams dang / na yig mtha' can rnams las ai yig gi rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri yig gi mtha' can rnams dang / na yig mtha' can rnams las ai yig gi rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: The final letters of the group ri and the final letters of the group na are changed to ai.

original: karti / padmi ni /
analyzed: karti / padmi ni /
translated: karti, padmini,

original: wa na'i ra'ang ngo //
analyzed: wa na'i ra'ang ngo //

original: wana'i rtags las a'i rkyen du 'gyur te /
analyzed: wana'i rtags las a'i rkyen du 'gyur te /

original: mtha'i re phar bsgyur ro //🔽dh'i wan / dh'i wa r'i /
analyzed: mtha'i re phar bsgyur ro // dh'i wan / dh'i wa r'i /

analyzed: grangs brjod pa las a'i rkyen du mi 'gyur te /

original: des na / d'irgha ka s'i ra thya zhes pa 'dir a'i'i rkyen te srog chags kyi sgra ni mthong ba rnams ra thy'a dang 'dra ba ru blta'o //

original: te na tset\ tad\ ta th'a yu tam zhes pa 'di dang 'di yang don ni ste na rang gi yan lag gi srog chags kyi las ma yin pa de ltar gal te yu tam dang 'brel pa'i skabs des /

translated: The meaning of this and this is: “If the life of a living being is not the action of its own parts, then, in that case, by the connection with yuta,

original: ji ltar srog chags kyi rdzas de ltar de yang rang gi yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar srog chags kyi rdzas de ltar de yang rang gi yan lag tu 'gyur ro //

translated: From an, and from karṇa, that is, from the end of a-karṇa, the condition of ai also occurs.

original: ba hu r'a dz'a /

analyzed: n'a si k'a dang au dar dag las dbyangs mang po las kroda sogs zhes pas dgag pa thab pa la'o //

translated: The vowels ṛ, ḷ, e, and ai do not occur before the superscripts of their own parts.🔽The word “not” is to be supplied to each of these.

analyzed: de nas zlas dbye pa'o //

analyzed: kro da sogs kyi mtha' dang dbyangs mang po'i mtha' las kyang a'i'i rkyen mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gang gi rol sgeg dge ba yin pa de ni ka lya na kro d'a /

analyzed: sho bha na khu r'a /

analyzed: dbyangs mang po'i mtha' las /

analyzed: gang gi tshangs ra yangs pa ma yin pa de ni /

analyzed: pri thu dza gha n'a /

original: sha shi ba da n'a /
analyzed: sha shi ba da n'a /

original: kro da khu ra sa thu gu da /
analyzed: kro da khu ra sa thu gu da /
translated: Kroḍakhurasaṭhagā.🔽Gā.

original: ga la / 'di rnams kyi tshogs kro da sogs so //
analyzed: ga la / 'di rnams kyi tshogs kro da sogs so //
translated: These are the groups of kroḍa and so forth.

original: gal te de lta na dbyangs mang po smos pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na dbyangs mang po smos pa don med do zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it is meaningless to mention a long vowel.

original: bden mod / rab tu spros pa'i don du'o //🔽aanta rbata las mngal dang ldan pa la nu'o //
analyzed: bden mod / rab tu spros pa'i don du'o // aanta rbata las mngal dang ldan pa la nu'o //
translated: It is true, but it is for the purpose of elaboration.🔽From anta rbhav, it is nu in the case of one who has a womb.

analyzed: aanta rbata zhes pa 'di las mngal dang ldan pa'i bud med la 'jug bzhin pa na pha rol du nu a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //

original: au yig ni brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: au yig ni brjod pa'i don to //

analyzed: aantarbatni garb'a n'i /

original: aantar gyi sgra las spyir btang ba'i nus pa gtso ba nyid kyi spyir btang ba'i rkyen bstan pa stobs dang ldan pa las auta rjes su 'brel pa las zhes pas a'i'i rkyen no //
analyzed: aantar gyi sgra las spyir btang ba'i nus pa gtso ba nyid kyi spyir btang ba'i rkyen bstan pa stobs dang ldan pa las auta rjes su 'brel pa las zhes pas a'i'i rkyen no //
translated: From the word antari, the general power is primary. The general condition is taught. From the powerful, after the suffix ut, the ai condition.

original: mngal dang ldan pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: mngal dang ldan pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: gang gi lan bu bar med pa yod pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gi lan bu bar med pa yod pa de ni /

original: aanta:s'a l'a / pa ti batn'a las srog 'dra'i chung ma la'o //
analyzed: aanta:s'a l'a / pa ti batn'a las srog 'dra'i chung ma la'o //

original: gang gi srog dang 'dra ba'i chung ma de ni srog 'dra'i chung ma'o //

original: aa na bi /
analyzed: aa na bi /

analyzed: aa'i ba ma dag la ring po'o zhes pas ring po'o //

analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi zhes pa'i mang po'i tshig ni gtso bo ma yin te /

original: ba tsa tha:/ tva tsa aa ham tsa /🔽pa ts'a ba /

original: snga ma bzhin bi ka ra na'i ring po'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin bi ka ra na'i ring po'o //

original: sngar bshad pa dang phyi mar 'chad pa'i yongs su bshad pa grub pa nyid kyi phyir sbyor ba rtsom pa ni yongs su bshad pa de kho na'i spros pa'i don to zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa dang phyi mar 'chad pa'i yongs su bshad pa grub pa nyid kyi phyir sbyor ba rtsom pa ni yongs su bshad pa de kho na'i spros pa'i don to zhes gsung ngo //
translated: He says that the composition of the application is for the purpose of elaborating just that explanation, because the explanation that was explained before and will be explained later is established.

original: ming la rab tu sbyor ba la'ang dang po'o //
analyzed: ming la rab tu sbyor ba la'ang dang po'o //

original: ming la rab tu sbyor bar gyur pa na byings las dang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming la rab tu sbyor bar gyur pa na byings las dang por 'gyur ro //

original: 'ang gi sgra las rab tu sbyor ba ma yin pa na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra las rab tu sbyor ba ma yin pa na yang ngo //
translated: From the word “also,” it is also when there is no application.

original: sab tsa ti too /
analyzed: sab tsa ti too /

original: pa tsa ta:/ te pa tsanti /
analyzed: pa tsa ta:/ te pa tsanti /

analyzed: rab tu sbyor ba ma yin pa la / pa tsa ti /

analyzed: pa tsa ta:/ pa tsanti /

original: ti ; tas /
analyzed: ti ; tas /

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: deng bsrung ba la'o //

analyzed: dudh'anya 'dzin pa la'o //

analyzed: dheta skyong ba la'o zhes pa 'di dag gi yang dh'a zhes pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de dha smos pas so //

analyzed: d'a dh'a zhes pa'i gzugs 'di dag ni dh'a'i ming can du 'gyur zhing /

original: deep\ dag par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: deep\ dag par byed pa la'o //

analyzed: d'apa dang deepa'i pa yig ni d'a pa ma yin pa zhes pa 'dir khyad par gyi don no //

original: bya ba rtogs byed ni byings so ;
analyzed: bya ba rtogs byed ni byings so ;

original: / bha ba ti aina'i mtha' can la bya ba rtogs par byed do zhes pas las la aana'o //
analyzed: / bha ba ti aina'i mtha' can la bya ba rtogs par byed do zhes pas las la aana'o //
translated: Since it is said that 'bhavati has the ending i, it causes the action to be understood', the ya affix is for the object.

original: k'a rita dbyi'o //
analyzed: k'a rita dbyi'o //
translated: Kārita is the root.

original: sgra gang zhig bya ba rtogs par byed cing so sor rtogs par byed pa de byings kyi ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra gang zhig bya ba rtogs par byed cing so sor rtogs par byed pa de byings kyi ming can du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bya bar bya'o zhes pas bya ba ste las kho na'o zhes pa'i don to //

original: byings las kyang rgyu la'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: byings las kyang rgyu la'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //

original: dus la'o // 'di ni spyir btang ba ste 'di las phyi mar gang 'chad pa de dus la'o zhes pa 'di nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: dus la'o // 'di ni spyir btang ba ste 'di las phyi mar gang 'chad pa de dus la'o zhes pa 'di nye bar gnas so //
translated: For time. This is a general statement. What is explained later from this is for time.

original: de rnams kyi rang ming gi zhes pas 'di las gong du 'di spyir btang ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang ming gi zhes pas 'di las gong du 'di spyir btang ba'o //

original: da ltar ba la barta m'a n'a'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba la barta m'a n'a'o //
translated: For the present, varttamānatīti.

original: sam sri ti'i sgra ni tshig phrad tshogs pa'i mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: sam sri ti'i sgra ni tshig phrad tshogs pa'i mi zad pa'o //
translated: The word samasati is the unchangeable of the collection of words.

original: da ltar gyi dus la ste 'jug bzhin pa'i dus la byings las brta m'a n'a'i rnam dbyer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus la ste 'jug bzhin pa'i dus la byings las brta m'a n'a'i rnam dbyer 'gyur ro //
translated: In the present time, in the time of engagement, it becomes the case-ending of the brtan ma na.

original: pa tha ti /
analyzed: pa tha ti /

original: aa dza ti /🔽barta m'a n'a'i ti'o //
analyzed: aa dza ti / barta m'a n'a'i ti'o //

original: aan bi ka ra na'o //
analyzed: aan bi ka ra na'o //

original: sma yis 'das pa la'o //
analyzed: sma yis 'das pa la'o //

original: sbyor ba'i sgra bdun pa'i mtha' can dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgra bdun pa'i mtha' can dgug par bya'o //
translated: The compound word ending in the seventh case should be attracted.

original: sma yis rte sma'i sgras sbyor bar gyur pa na byings las 'das pa'i dus la brta m'a n'a 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sma yis rte sma'i sgras sbyor bar gyur pa na byings las 'das pa'i dus la brta m'a n'a 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the compound becomes by the word rtesma, the brtan ma na becomes the past time from the root.

original: hya sta n'i dang aa dya ta n'i dang pa ronyaksha rnams 'gog pa la'o //
analyzed: hya sta n'i dang aa dya ta n'i dang pa ronyaksha rnams 'gog pa la'o //

original: ai ti sma m'a t'a bra b'i mi /

original: bru nya gsal bar smra ba la'o //
analyzed: bru nya gsal bar smra ba la'o //

original: barta m'a n'a'i mi'o //
analyzed: barta m'a n'a'i mi'o //

original: aan bi ka ra na'o //
analyzed: aan bi ka ra na'o //
translated: An bikara na.

original: aad sogs las 'jig go //
analyzed: aad sogs las 'jig go //

original: bru ba las a'ita tshig dang po zhes pas a'ita'o //
analyzed: bru ba las a'ita tshig dang po zhes pas a'ita'o //

analyzed: ta yig ni aita las kyang a'ita la'o zhes pa'i don to //

original: ka tha tshig gi rgyun la'o //
analyzed: ka tha tshig gi rgyun la'o //

analyzed: tsu ra la sogs pa las kyang ngo zhes pas ain'a'o //

original: aa'i yang dbyi'o zhes pas tha'i aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa'i yang dbyi'o zhes pas tha'i aa yig dbyi'o //

original: de'i dbyangs bsgyur ba pha rol gyi rgyu mtshan can no zhes pas gnas can bzhin du 'gyur bas au pa dh'a ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir au pa dh'a aa zhes pas ka ring por mi 'gyur ro //

translated: The change of its vowel is due to the reason of the other. Thus it is like the possessor of a place. Because it is not upadhā, it is not upadhā. Thus the long ka does not occur.

analyzed: ka thi zhes gnas pa la brta m'a n'a'i ti'o //

original: aan bi ka ra na'o //
analyzed: aan bi ka ra na'o //

original: yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan no //

original: aa k'arsh'i ta ka tam de ba datta:/

analyzed: ngas byas zin zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: 'das pa la'o zhes pa kho na ste /

analyzed: dza h'a ra pri thi bi mva le:/

analyzed: du kri nya byed pa la'o //

analyzed: hri nya 'phrog pa la'o //

analyzed: ha'i dza'o // au pa dh'a'i aa zhes pas 'phel pa ste a'ar'o //

analyzed: byung ba'i byed pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang ngo ;

original: aing klog pa la'o //

original: shvasta n'i'i t'a'o //
analyzed: shvasta n'i'i t'a'o //

original: yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan no //

original: sh'a ga mi shya ti zhes pa 'di la ni ga mi shya ti zhes pa'i tshig 'di 'byung bar 'gyur pa spyi la 'dus byas nas phyi nas shvas kyi sgras 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a ga mi shya ti zhes pa 'di la ni ga mi shya ti zhes pa'i tshig 'di 'byung bar 'gyur pa spyi la 'dus byas nas phyi nas shvas kyi sgras 'brel pa'o //

original: gamli 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: gamli 'gro ba la'o //

original: rab tu sbyor ba las kyang ngo //

original: dus kyi khyad par ro zhes kyang ngo //
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par ro zhes kyang ngo //

original: gal te yang snga ma la dus kyi khyad par ro zhes pa de'i skyes bur gyur pa de lta na'ang 'dir don gyi dbang las 'dzin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yang snga ma la dus kyi khyad par ro zhes pa de'i skyes bur gyur pa de lta na'ang 'dir don gyi dbang las 'dzin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: If, indeed, in the former, the difference of time, then that which is the person, even so, here, from the power of the meaning, the taking should be understood.

original: barta m'a n'a yang 'dir 'brel par bya'o ;
analyzed: barta m'a n'a yang 'dir 'brel par bya'o ;

original: / rab tu sbyor ba ni mchog gi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: / rab tu sbyor ba ni mchog gi sbyor ba ste /

original: mchog gi sbyor ba de las barta m'a n'a la sogs pa'i rnam dbye rnams kyi dus kyi khyad par du 'gyur zhing khyad par can gyi dus su 'gyur te /
analyzed: mchog gi sbyor ba de las barta m'a n'a la sogs pa'i rnam dbye rnams kyi dus kyi khyad par du 'gyur zhing khyad par can gyi dus su 'gyur te /

analyzed: dus gzhan la yang mchog gi sbyor ba las barta m'a n'a la sogs pa rnams 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //

original: y'a batbhudte / y'a bata @159a * //

analyzed: de dag sbyor ba na 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la barta m'a n'a'o //

original: bhu dza skyong ba la'o //
analyzed: bhu dza skyong ba la'o //
translated: Bhuja is for protecting.🔽Te is for the present.

original: te'o // ru dha sogs kyi dbyangs las zhes pas na sgra'o //
analyzed: te'o // ru dha sogs kyi dbyangs las zhes pas na sgra'o //

analyzed: ru dha la sogs pa'i bi ka ra na'i mtha' dbyi'o zhes pas na sgra'i aa dbyi'o //
translated: Since it is said that the final of the vikarana of ru and so on is the vowel a, it is the vowel a of sound.

original: tsa sde'i ki'o zhes pas dza'i ka'o //
analyzed: tsa sde'i ki'o zhes pas dza'i ka'o //

original: sde pa la sde pa'i mtha' 'o //
analyzed: sde pa la sde pa'i mtha' 'o //

original: gang gi tshe y'a bata dang su ra'i sgra dag ni p'a ta yin pa de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus la brta m'a n'a'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe y'a bata dang su ra'i sgra dag ni p'a ta yin pa de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus la brta m'a n'a'o //

analyzed: gang gi tshe n'i p'a ta ma yin pa de'i tshe ni rang gi dus la ste bha bi shyam ti kho na'o //

original: y'a badd'a sya ti /
analyzed: y'a badd'a sya ti /

original: t'a bata bhyoshya te /
analyzed: t'a bata bhyoshya te /

analyzed: aa na y'a su r'a bra dzi shya ti zhes pa'o //

analyzed: ka d'a dang kara hi dag sbyor ba na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus la brta m'a n'a rnam par brtag pas bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: ka d'a bhudkte /

original: kardi bhokshye te /
analyzed: kardi bhokshye te /

analyzed: bhu dza skyong ba la'o //

original: bha bi shyam ti'i sya te'o //
analyzed: bha bi shyam ti'i sya te'o //

analyzed: n'a mi na'i yang au pa dh'a'i'o zhes pas yon tan no //

analyzed: sha nyid do //

analyzed: rjes su 'dod pa la panytsa m'i'o //

analyzed: bhu yod pa la'o //

analyzed: tu hi zhes pa 'di dag gi smon pa rtogs par bya bzhin pa na t'a ta na yang na bshad par bya'o // dz'i ba t'ada bha b'an /

analyzed: dz'i ba srog 'dzin pa la'o //

analyzed: panytsa m'i'i tu dang hi'o //

analyzed: na yig ni na rjes su 'brel pa dang / tse kri yi ta dag la ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: ta yig las aa yig ni brjod pa'i don to //

analyzed: aan bi ka ra na'o //

analyzed: gang gi tshe hi bsgyur ba med pa de'i tshe hi'i aa yig las zhes pa de dbyi'o //

original: aa dya ta n'i las si tsa'o zhes pas si tsa'o //
analyzed: aa dya ta n'i las si tsa'o zhes pas si tsa'o //
translated: From adhyāyana, sicyā.🔽From sicyā, parasmai.

analyzed: si tsa las pa ra smee la'o zhes pas 'phel ba'i si tsa las so zhes pas a'i ta'o //

original: byings kyi dang po aata thob pa ni /
analyzed: byings kyi dang po aata thob pa ni /
translated: The first of the roots, adhi, is obtained.

original: m'a dang m'asma sbyor ba dag la ma yin no zhes pas bkag go //
analyzed: m'a dang m'asma sbyor ba dag la ma yin no zhes pas bkag go //
translated: It is prohibited in the case of the combination of mā and asmi.

original: m'a l'a b'i ta /
analyzed: m'a l'a b'i ta /
translated: Mā is lābha.

original: m'a p'a b'ita ;🔽l'u nya gcod /
analyzed: m'a p'a b'ita ; l'u nya gcod /
translated: Mā is pāpa.🔽Lū is cutting.

original: p'u nya 'khyud pa la'o //
analyzed: p'u nya 'khyud pa la'o //
translated: Pū is embracing.

original: m'a sbyor ro //
analyzed: m'a sbyor ro //
translated: Mā is joining.

original: di'o // sica'o //
analyzed: di'o // sica'o //
translated: Di. Si.

original: aita'o // a'ita'o //
analyzed: aita'o // a'ita'o //
translated: Ita. Iti.

original: aita las kyang aita la'o zhes pas si tsa dbyi'o //
analyzed: aita las kyang aita la'o zhes pas si tsa dbyi'o //
translated: From ita, also ita.

original: snga ma bzhin du 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'phel ba'o //
translated: As before, it increases.

original: sbyor ba smos pas ni dgag pa byed pa'i sgra yongs su 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba smos pas ni dgag pa byed pa'i sgra yongs su 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
translated: By mentioning the combination, the word that expresses prohibition is taken as the meaning.

original: des na gnyis pa'i mtha'i m'a'i sgra'i m'a gang yin pa bsgyur ba de dang sbyor ba la 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gnyis pa'i mtha'i m'a'i sgra'i m'a gang yin pa bsgyur ba de dang sbyor ba la 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mā sound at the end of the second is not changed in the combination where that mā is changed.

original: de'o do tto m'a aa pa shya ta /
analyzed: de'o do tto m'a aa pa shya ta /
translated: That, that, tat, mā, a, paśya.

original: dri shir lta ba la'o //
analyzed: dri shir lta ba la'o //
translated: Diś is seeing.

original: hyasta n'i'i di'o //
analyzed: hyasta n'i'i di'o //
translated: Hya is the di of nastī.

original: aana bi / dri shi'i pa shya'o //
analyzed: aana bi / dri shi'i pa shya'o //
translated: anvi

original: m'asma sbyor ba la hyasta ni spang ngo //
analyzed: m'asma sbyor ba la hyasta ni spang ngo //
translated: masma, in the compound, hyaṣṭa is dropped.

original: m'asma'i sgra dang sbyor ba la byings las aa dya ta n'ir 'gyur te /
analyzed: m'asma'i sgra dang sbyor ba la byings las aa dya ta n'ir 'gyur te /
translated: In the compound with the word masma, from the root, adya becomes ṇi.

original: hyasta n'i spang ngo ;
analyzed: hyasta n'i spang ngo ;
translated: Hyaṣṭa is dropped.

original: / re zhig sya ta n'i /
analyzed: / re zhig sya ta n'i /
translated: Now, syāt ṇi.

original: m'asma k'arsh'ita / m'asma p'aksh'ita /
analyzed: m'asma k'arsh'ita / m'asma p'aksh'ita /
translated: masma, kārṣi, masma, pakṣi.

original: du krinya byed pa la'o //
analyzed: du krinya byed pa la'o //
translated: dukri, in the causative.

original: du pa tsa sha 'tshed pa la'o //
analyzed: du pa tsa sha 'tshed pa la'o //
translated: dupa, in the causative.

original: m'asma sbyor ro //
analyzed: m'asma sbyor ro //
translated: masma, in the compound.

original: aa dya ta n'i'i di'o //🔽aa dya ta n'i las si tsa'o zhes pas si tsa'o //
analyzed: aa dya ta n'i'i di'o // aa dya ta n'i las si tsa'o zhes pas si tsa'o //

original: si tsa las zhes pas a'ita'o //
analyzed: si tsa las zhes pas a'ita'o //

original: si tsa la pa rasmee la'o zhes pas 'phel ba la ste aa yang ring po'o ;
analyzed: si tsa la pa rasmee la'o zhes pas 'phel ba la ste aa yang ring po'o ;

original: / tsa sde'i ki'o //
analyzed: / tsa sde'i ki'o //

original: m'a dang m'asma sbyor ba la ma yin no zhes bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: m'a dang m'asma sbyor ba la ma yin no zhes bkag pa'i phyir ro //

original: aa yig a'a ga ma med do //
analyzed: aa yig a'a ga ma med do //

original: hyasta n'i'i di /🔽m'asma ka ro ta /
analyzed: hyasta n'i'i di / m'asma ka ro ta /
translated: hyaṣṭa ṇi.🔽masma karoti.

original: m'asma pa tsa ta /
analyzed: m'asma pa tsa ta /
translated: masma pacati.

original: hasta n'i'i di'o //
analyzed: hasta n'i'i di'o //
translated: hyaṣṭa ṇi.

original: ta na sogs las au'o //
analyzed: ta na sogs las au'o //
translated: From ta and so on, au.

original: aana bi / ka ro ti'i'o zhes pas yon tan no //
analyzed: aana bi / ka ro ti'i'o zhes pas yon tan no //

original: barta m'a n'a rnams ni /🔽ti ; tasra /🔽aanti / si /
analyzed: barta m'a n'a rnams ni / ti ; tasra / aanti / si /

original: thas / tha /🔽mi / basra /
analyzed: thas / tha / mi / basra /

original: masra / te /
analyzed: masra / te /

original: a'ate / aante /🔽se / a'a the /
analyzed: a'ate / aante / se / a'a the /
translated: âte, ânte,🔽se, âthe,

original: dhve / ae /
analyzed: dhve / ae /
translated: dhve, e,🔽vahe, mahe.

original: ba he / ma he'o zhes pa 'di'i mtha' rnams la zlas dbye ba byas nas dzas so //
analyzed: ba he / ma he'o zhes pa 'di'i mtha' rnams la zlas dbye ba byas nas dzas so //

original: dang por dbyi'o zhes pas dbyi'o //
analyzed: dang por dbyi'o zhes pas dbyi'o //

original: de bzhin du thams cad la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la'o //

analyzed: ti la sogs pa rnams ni brta m'a n'a'i ming can du 'gyur ro //

original: barta m'a n'a'i ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: barta m'a n'a'i ming gang du dgos she na /

analyzed: da ltar ba la brta m'a n'a'o zhes pa 'dir ro // bha ba ti /

original: bha ba ta:/ bha banti /
analyzed: bha ba ta:/ bha banti /

original: bh'u yod pa la'o //
analyzed: bh'u yod pa la'o //

original: barta m'a n'a'i ti tasa aanti'o //
analyzed: barta m'a n'a'i ti tasa aanti'o //

original: aanbi / na min mtha'i zhes pas yon tan no //
analyzed: aanbi / na min mtha'i zhes pas yon tan no //

original: aa dang @161b mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa dang @161b mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge dbyi'o //

original: pa rasmee'i tshig dang a'atma ne'i tshig gi ming dag 'dir nye bar gnas shing pha rol dgu rnams zhes pa'i tshig gi phyir dang / pa rasmee'i tshig shugs las snga ma dgu rnams rnam par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: pa rasmee'i tshig dang a'atma ne'i tshig gi ming dag 'dir nye bar gnas shing pha rol dgu rnams zhes pa'i tshig gi phyir dang / pa rasmee'i tshig shugs las snga ma dgu rnams rnam par shes par bya ste /
translated: The words of parasmai and atmane are placed here, because of the word navapara, and the words of parasmai are understood from the force of the words.

original: des ni ti sogs rnams kyi gang snga ma'i tshig dgu po de rnams la pa rasmee'i tshig gi ming can dang gang phyi ma de rnams ni aatma ne'i tshig gi ming can no //
analyzed: des ni ti sogs rnams kyi gang snga ma'i tshig dgu po de rnams la pa rasmee'i tshig gi ming can dang gang phyi ma de rnams ni aatma ne'i tshig gi ming can no //
translated: Therefore, the nine words that come before ti and so on are called words of parasmai, and those that come after are called words of atmane.

original: sapta m'i rnams ni /🔽y'at\/ y'a tam\/ yus\/🔽y'as\/ y'a tama /
analyzed: sapta m'i rnams ni / y'at\/ y'a tam\/ yus\/ y'as\/ y'a tama /

original: a'i ma hi'o //
analyzed: a'i ma hi'o //

analyzed: y'ata la sogs pa rnams sapta m'i'i ming can du 'gyur ro //

original: 'di la sogs pa rnams 'di lta kho nar te klog pa'i rim pa 'di kho nas aadya ta n'i'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa rnams 'di lta kho nar te klog pa'i rim pa 'di kho nas aadya ta n'i'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: These and others are just like this. By this very order of reading, they become the name Ādyatāna.

original: aa dya ta ni'i ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: aa dya ta ni'i ming gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is the name Ādyatāna needed?

original: aa dya ta n'i dang a'a sh'isha dag la'ang a'atma ne la'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: aa dya ta n'i dang a'a sh'isha dag la'ang a'atma ne la'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: In the words Ādyatāna and Āśiṣa, in the words Ātmanepada and so on.

original: aa bhitta / aa bhi t+sa t'a ;
analyzed: aa bhitta / aa bhi t+sa t'a ;
translated: Abhitta, abhitsātā,

original: aa bhi t+sa ta /
analyzed: aa bhi t+sa ta /
translated: abhitsata.

original: bhi dir rnam par 'joms pa la'o //
analyzed: bhi dir rnam par 'joms pa la'o //
translated: Bhidir means “to conquer.”

original: aa dya ta n'i'i ta a'a t'am aanta'o //🔽aa dya ta n'i la si tsa'o zhes pas si tsa'o //
analyzed: aa dya ta n'i'i ta a'a t'am aanta'o // aa dya ta n'i la si tsa'o zhes pas si tsa'o //
translated: The T of Ādyatāna is Ā or Ț at the end.🔽The S is from the class of the sibilants.

original: dhuta las kyang dhu ta la'o zhes pas si tsa dbyi'o //
analyzed: dhuta las kyang dhu ta la'o zhes pas si tsa dbyi'o //
translated: The T is from the class of the sibilants.

original: a'atma ne la'ang aa yig ma yin pa las so zhes pas na dbyi'o //
analyzed: a'atma ne la'ang aa yig ma yin pa las so zhes pas na dbyi'o //
translated: The T is not from the class of the sibilants.

original: aa dya ta n'i dang a'a sh'i sha dag la yang a'atma ne la'o zhes pas yon tan med do //
analyzed: aa dya ta n'i dang a'a sh'i sha dag la yang a'atma ne la'o zhes pas yon tan med do //
translated: In the case of adhyatna and āśīrṣa, the ātmne is also ātmāne, so there is no quality.

original: pa ro& ksha rnams ni /
analyzed: pa ro& ksha rnams ni /
translated: The parā and kṣa are:

original: aa\ta / aatus\/ aus\/
analyzed: aa\ta / aatus\/ aus\/
translated: at, atus, us,

original: thal\/ aa thus /🔽aa / aa\ta /
analyzed: thal\/ aa thus / aa / aa\ta /
translated: thal, athus,

original: ba / ma /🔽ae / a'a te /
analyzed: ba / ma / ae / a'a te /
translated: a, at,

original: ai re / se /
analyzed: ai re / se /
translated: I re.🔽Se.🔽

original: a'a the / dhve /
analyzed: a'a the / dhve /
translated: e, āt,🔽i, re, se,

original: ae / ba he /
analyzed: ae / ba he /
translated: ā, athe, dwhe,🔽e, vahe,🔽mahe.

original: ma he'o // aad la sogs pa rnams ni pa ro& ksha'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma he'o // aad la sogs pa rnams ni pa ro& ksha'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The a and so forth become the names of parā and kṣa.

original: pa ro& ksha'i ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: pa ro& ksha'i ming gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is the name of parā and kṣa needed?

original: pa ro& ksha la'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: pa ro& ksha la'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //

original: bi bhi da dhu:/
analyzed: bi bhi da dhu:/
translated: Vibhidhūḥ,

original: bi bhi du:/ bhi dir rnam par 'byed pa la'o //
analyzed: bi bhi du:/ bhi dir rnam par 'byed pa la'o //
translated: vibhiduḥ, bhidir, in the case of dividing.

original: aa tus\ dang / aus\'o //
analyzed: aa tus\ dang / aus\'o //
translated: Atus, us,

original: tsa na pa ro& ksh'a zhes pa gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: tsa na pa ro& ksh'a zhes pa gnyis brjod do //

original: gnyis pa bzhi pa dag gi zhes pas bha'i ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa bzhi pa dag gi zhes pas bha'i ba'o //

analyzed: pa ro& ksha la'ang ngo zhes pas yon tan med do //

analyzed: t'asthas\/ t'astha / t'asmi /

analyzed: taswas\/ t'asmas\/ t'a / t'a roo // t'a ras /

analyzed: t'a se / t'a s'a the / tadhve / t'a he /

original: tasva he / tasma he'o //
analyzed: tasva he / tasma he'o //

original: ta la sogs pa rnams shvasta ni'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ta la sogs pa rnams shvasta ni'i ming can du 'gyur ro //

original: shvasta ni'i ming can gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: shvasta ni'i ming can gang du dgos she na /

original: 'byung 'gyur la bha bi shyam ti dang a'a sh'i sha dang shvasta n'i rnams so zhes pa 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'byung 'gyur la bha bi shyam ti dang a'a sh'i sha dang shvasta n'i rnams so zhes pa 'dir ro //
